intro: Callithronum, commonly known as the golden trumpet or desert bell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with a distinctive red or purple throat. The plants are typically shrubs or small trees, adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. They have opposite, simple leaves and produce capsules as fruits. Callithronum species are native to regions of Africa, the Arabian Peninsula, and parts of Asia.
